text: I now give the floor to his Excellency
basam sabba Vice Minister of Foreign
Affairs and expatriates of the Syrian
rep Arab
Republic your
Excellency
excellence
your Excellency Mr Dennis Francis
president of the general
assembly at the outset I would like to
congratulate you on your election
President of the general assembly at its
current session I would like to thank
your predecessor Mr Chaba Karachi for
his presidency of the previous session I
also thank his Excellency the Secretary
General for the efforts he's making to
implement the provisions of the UN
Charter in line with the Mandate
entrusted to him ladies and gentlemen
our world today is witnessing important
Transformations and an increase of
serious challenges formost being the
outbreak of devastating conflicts in
many regions around the world the
continued occupation of some peoples of
the world the spread of the scourge of
terrorism declining rates of development
and a sharp rise in the rates of poverty
and hunger in addition to the
catastrophic impacts of the unilateral
coercive
measures that in addition to the
economic blockade policies and the
negative repercussions of climate change
and its related natural
disasters confronting all these
challenges is an urgent need for us
all as they reflect on the
future of the generations to come
eliminating them or mitigating their
impact to a minimum requires Global
cooperation among member States it also
requires solidarity and concerted effort
to build a new multi-polar world order
that achieves a new balance in
international relations including
through reforming International
institutions
and other institutions for most the
security Council it also requires true
sustainable development that guarantees
the benefit and well-being of All
Peoples of the world Mr President the
policies of creative chaos adopted by
successive American administrations in
our region to serve their geopolitical
and selfish interests have led to
destabilization and
insecurity they worked to create and
exaggerate problems to ignite
tension thereby resulting in conflicts
they spent billions of dollars to
demolish and Destroy development
achievements made over decades they
contributed to the emergence of the
phenomenon of extremism and terrorism
such as the terrorist organizations isil
and alra
front multilateralism the United Nations
Charter and other relevant International
agreements were not spared from this
creative American chaos over the past 10
years we have witnessed an increasing
tendency to misinterpret and misapply
the provisions of the charter especially
article 51
thereof they were used as an excuse to
justify attacks against the sovereignty
Independence and territorial Integrity
of other countries
they manipulated the provisions of
international conventions and treaties
and politicized human rights issues to
justify interfering in the internal
affairs of other countries and bringing
pressure to bear on them Mr
President the basic principle affirmed
by the charter of the United Nations is
the respect of sovereignty Independence
unity and territorial Integrity of
member states thus any acquisition of
land of others by force is an occupation
any illegal military presence on the
territory of a sovereign state is a
clear violation of this Charter and a
plain breach of international law it
must end immediately without
preconditions or limitations
accordingly Israel's occupation of the
Arab lands in Palestine and the Syrian
Gan since
1967 until this very
day and the resulting and consequent
construction of settlement change of the
demographic composition institutional
structure especially through attempts to
forcefully impose the Israeli
citizenship on the people of the
Gan not to mention the plundering of the
natural resources of the Gan the seizure
of Syrian fers lands to build huge wind
turbines and other documented violations
all of the above represent the most
heinous forms of grave and systematic
violations of the UN Charter and of
international humanitarian law the
Syrian Arab Republic reaffirms its
legitimate right to restore the the
entire occupied Syrian Gan after the
line of June 4th
1967 no matter how long it takes it is
an inalienable right that is not subject
to to compromise our pressure and is not
subject to the statute of limitations it
is guaranteed by international law and
relevant un resolutions especially
Security Council resolution number 497
of the Year
1981 Syria also stresses that it will
exercise its legitimate right to defend
its Landing people by all necessary
means
and to ensure that the Israeli
occupation authorities are held
accountable for all their crimes with no
impunity Mr
President Syria has and Remains the
supporter of the Palestinian calls as it
is the central Arab calls Syria has
spared no effort to stand alongside the
brotherly Palestinian people in their
legitimate struggle to regain their
legitimate rights especially their right
to establish their independent
statehood on their land with Jerusalem
as its capital and to Grant Palestine
full membership in the United
Nations what we have witnessed this year
of dangerous escalation of Israeli
criminal
practices in which the number of
victims has reached its highest level is
pushing the region to unprecedented
level of tension and instability this is
examplified in the in committing more
massacres the escalation of its military
aggression and its repeated missile
bombing of Syrian cities ports and civil
airports this has endangered civilian
lives and the safety of civil aviation
it has also hampered un humanitarian
operations moreover it has continued its
policies of settlement rudis ation Siege
arbitrary arrest false displacement and
racial discrimination in the occupied
Arab
territories while the Syrian Arab
Republic condemns in the strongest terms
all these Israeli crimes and attacks it
equally denounces the continued support
for such practices or the Silence of
some countries that Proclaim themselves
Protectors of international humanitarian
law and human rights law this makes them
complicit with the perpetrators of these
crimes it clearly demonstrates their
double
standards Mr
President the continued Israeli
occupation of Arab lands and its brutal
practices are consistent with the
destructive role played by some
countries on Syrian lands the United
States and turkey continue to violate
Syria's sovereignty unity and
territorial Integrity by insisting on
their continued presence illegal
military presence on Syrian lands and
supporting separatist militias and
terrorist
organizations this is in addition to
the uh visits by Western political and
military officials and others to Syrian
territory by infiltrating Syrian
territory without any respect for
serious sovereignty and Independence
this is considered a flagrant
interference in its Internal Affairs the
systematic and exposed American plunder
of the Syrian People's National wealth
such as oil gas and wheat has deprived
the syrians of their resources it has
exacerbated their humanitarian suffering
in an unprecedented manner our latest
statistics show that the total value of
direct and indirect losses caused to the
the oil sector in Syria has exceeded
$5 billion us we believe that the United
Nations is obligated to hold the UN
United States accountable and ask it to
return this looted money to the Syrian
government in
parallel the United States of America
and its European allies continue to
impose unilateral coercive measures that
are illegal immoral and inhumane on
various sectors in Syria this has only
contributed to exacerbate the suffering
of syrians wherever they are given the
fact that their impact includes third
countries the Secretary General has
noted in his
reports the impact of these measures on
un procurement and payments these
countries intentionally include in their
measures the public health sector the
banking sector the trans transport
sector the Syrian civil aviation
equipment and the energy sector it also
includes Banning the supply of oil and
its derivatives to Syria or the import
of power plants equipment related to
power generation or spare parts they
also include bans on importing equipment
and Machinery necessary for drinking
water supply irrigation water
sterilization and purification and
repair and Improvement of the sewage
system the agricultural sector was not
spared from these unilateral sanctions
as they included preventing the import
of fertilizers and Machinery necessary
for agricultural production that
provides food for the syrians Mr
President ladies and
gentlemen Syria was one of the most
stable and prosperous countries in the
world it was achieving food
self-sufficiency and providing all the
basic necessities of life for its people
in a way that was rarely seen in the
region however the terrorist War
launched against Syria since 2011
altered the situation it caused a
humanitarian
crisis that was very significant the
severity was aggravated by the
imposition of unilateral Cove measures
recently the devastating earthquake that
struck Syria on February the 6th of this
year added a new burden and more
suffering the earthquake destroyed
hundreds of buildings infrastructure and
service facilities it caused thousands
of victims and injuries and made tens of
thousands homeless the Syrian government
has been Keen to take all measures to
facilitate the arrival of humanitarian
Aid and relief workers to all affected
areas it has granted and still Grants
open approvals to the UN and
International organizations working in
Syria to facilitate and accelerate the
entry of um emergency relief supplies to
support the affected it also opened by a
sovereign decision a border crossing to
facilitate the humanitarian response in
the affected areas under the control of
terrorist organizations in Northwestern
Syria in this regard the Syrian Arab
Republic renews its thanks and
appreciation to all countries that stood
in solidarity with Syria and its people
all those who have rushed to respond to
the needs of the Syrian people in light
of the difficult circumstances they
faced it also expresses its appreciation
to the Secretary General of the United
Nations for launching The Flash appeal
to respond to the catastrophic
repercussions of the
earthquake the Syrian government is
still continuing within its limited
capabilities to make every effort to
address the impact of the earthquake in
all four affected Governor rates last
May the president of the Republic issued
a decree establishing the National Fund
to support those affected by the
earthquake with the aim of providing
them financial support and helping them
overcome the resulting physical material
or psychological harm this decree
represented the foundation of the basic
directions and the National Action Plan
approved by the Syrian government to
address the repercussions the
repercussions of the earthquake from
various aspects and this to move from
the emergency response phase of
delivering relief work to the recovery
phase the Syrian Arab Republic
reiterates that improving the
humanitarian situation in Syria requires
providing Sustainable Solutions to
support the syrians especially after the
earthquake
it requires increasing the size and
quantity of early recovery projects in a
way that reduces dependency on
life-saving humanitarian
Aid and uh increases the syrians
resilience it would also help provide
conditions for a dignified and voluntary
return of displaced persons and refugees
to
their uh Origins however this requires
providing the necessary funding through
International donors fulfilling the
pledges they have made Mr
President turning to the return of
refugees Syria declares before this
International recognization from this
Podium its Readiness to welcome the
return of every Syrian refugee who left
their home Village or city we call upon
this our citizens who were forced by
terrorist organizations to seek Refuge
to return to their Homeland the Syrian
government has taken all necessary
decisions in this field we are
cooperating with the High Commissioner
for refugees and the Arab contact
committee to reach this Noble goal in
this regard I call upon Western
countries that ask refugees not to
return to their Homeland to stop these
inhumane
practices in parallel Syria responded
positively to the efforts and
initiatives presented within the
framework of the political track it
supported the approach of local
settlement and National
reconciliation as a way to restore
conditions to normaly all over the
country this would also strengthen
National unity and the cohesion of the
Syrian Society it has participated in
the meetings held in the aana format it
welcomed its results and maintained
communication with a special Envoy to
Syria Mr President
the Arab Summit held in May in jeda in
the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia has made a
great achievement it restored to the
collective Arab position its fine and to
the Arab joint action its
momentum during that Summit the Arab
countries AFF found their support for
Syria in preserving its sovereignty and
territorial Integrity to overcome the
difficult circumstances as it's going
through as a result of the terrorist War
launched against it and the economic
sanctions imposed upon it in addition to
the repercussions of the devastating
earthquake that struck the country Syria
expresses its support and solidarity
with the Libyan people in facing the
repercussions of the hurricane and Fs
that struck the country as well as the
Moroccan people due to the devastating
earthquake Syria reaffirms its support
for the right of the Russian Federation
to defend itself and protect its
National
Security in response to aggressive
Western policies in doing
so they are not only defending
themselves but also the rights of all of
us to reject the logic of Western and
unipolar hemony Syria commends the
constructive and responsible approach of
the Islamic Republic of Iran to return
to the Joint comprehensive plan of
action from which the the USA has un
unilaterally and illegally
withdrew it calls upon the United States
and its Western allies to meet Iran's
legitimate demands Syria supports the
one China principle it supports the
positions of the People's Republic of
China in confronting attempts at um
external interference in its Internal
Affairs whether in Taiwan Hong Kong or
Jing
Jang it stresses China's in alienable
right to take whatever measures and
steps it decides to defend its
sovereignty
especially to counter the unprecedented
escalation and provocation policy
practiced by the USA against
it Syria condemns
the unjust economic blockade imposed on
Cuba for decades including the US
administration's extension of the
so-called trading with the Enemy law
Syria calls for an end to the military
action and exercises conducted by the
United States on the Korean Peninsula
which lead to escalation of tension in
this region Syria also demands the
lifting of all forms of unilateral
coercive measures imposed by Western
countries on the Russian Federation Iran
Venezuela bellarus Nicaragua the
Democratic People's Republic of Korea
Zimbabwe Z bwe arrian against my country
Syria it considers them economic
terrorism no less brutal or dangerous
than armed terrorism especially in terms
of its catastrophic humanitarian effect
on the targeted
peoples to conclude Mr President ladies
and
gentlemen the platform of the United
Nations General Assembly was created to
be a platform for dialogue and public
diplomacy among member states and not a
platform for leveling false accusations
or launching hostile campaigns against
each other that is why we look forward
to the current session of the general
assembly under your leadership Mr
Francis we look forward to it being able
to fulfill the slogan you raised that is
rebuilding trust and reigniting Global
solidarity accelerating action on the
2030 agenda and its sustainable
development goals towards peace
prosperity progress and sustainability
for
all this can be achieved by working to
translate it into real and serious
action that contributes to giving all
countries Fair opportunities that ensure
no one is Left Behind it would also
consolidate the position and status of
the general assembly as the most
representative body in the United
Nations thank you Mr
[Applause]
President I thank the vice Minister for
foreign affairs and expatriates of the
Syrian Arab
Republic
